scenario.data.tutorial_movement.name: Movement & Exploration
scenario.data.tutorial_movement.descript: Learn how to use <style="value">Cards</style> and <style="value">Mana</style> to Move around the Map and Explore
You will learn to use cards to generate Movement points to <style="status">Move</style> and <style="status">Explore</style> until you reach the Village.

When activating cards you can de-activate them if you change your mind (<style="status">Undoing</style>) which is a very <style="value">important concept</style> in this game.

Don't rush, take your time to evaluate the situation and try things. Cards & Mana will only be committed if you Move, Explore or Reveal new information.
scenario.data.tutorial_movement.objectiv: Use a card's <style="value">Basic (Top)</style> Action to Generate Movement

The Card's <style="value">Basic Action</style> (Top) is typically free.

When activating cards that generate point-based effects like Movement, they are added to the top of your screen (under XP bar). Use those points to Move and Explore.

Unless you have already Moved or Explored you can click the Basic Action again to <style="status">Undo</style> the card effect.
Use a card's <style="value">Advanced (Bottom)</style> Action to Generate Movement

The Card's Advanced Action (Bottom) typically costs Mana to use. Available Mana can be found on the right-side of the screen in your Inventory and Ambient (provided by the Environment). You can only use 1 Ambient Mana. Used Ambient Mana will be re-rolled later. Crystals in Inventory will be consumed when used. To pay the mana cost, after selecting the effect, click on the Mana icon next to the "Activate" button. This will be done automatically for simple cards. Don't forget that unless you Move, Explore or reveal new information you can click the Advanced Action again to Undo the card effects and return the used Mana to the Inventory / Ambient panel.
Use a card's <style="value">Default (Middle)</style> Action to Generate Movement

Every card provides a free <style="value">Default Action</style> (Middle) that gives you one of:

* Move<sprite name="card_icon_move"><style="value">1</style> - for Movement & Exploration,
* Attack<sprite name="card_icon_attack"><style="value">1</style> - used in Battle,
* Block<sprite name="card_icon_block"><style="value">1</style> - used in Battle,
* Leadership<sprite name="card_icon_influence"><style="value">1</style> - for buying stuff.

To move you first need to generate <style="value">Movement Points</style> by activating cards. Movement points are added into a pool shown under the XP bar (on top).

The cost to move to each space is shown on the hex (additional details if you hover your mouse) and can be affected by cards.

You can only move from one <style="value">adjacent</style> space to the next.

Moving will commit your cards and consume the Mana used for payment.

To explore you first need to move adjacent to the space you want to explore. Exploring requires <style="value">2</style> movement points in your pool. The exploration cost and distance is shown if you hover the mouse and can be affected by cards.

Exploring will reveal a new section (7 spaces) for which you can see the outline on the Map.

Exploring will commit your cards and consume the Mana used for payment.

Explore the next section and use Cards and Mana judiciously to find and reach the village and complete this tutorial.

Study the Terrain, Cards and available Mana to find the best strategy to get there.
